title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 358-2.1 - Plans which were not in existence april 13, 1949
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 358-2.1 - Plans which were not in existence april 13, 1949

State Regulations

Any plan which was not in existence on April 13, 1949, but which is in existence on or after July 1, 1950, is a new plan and, if the
benefits provided meet the requirements of section
358-3.1
of this Part, may be
accepted by the chairman under section
211
of the Workers' Compensation Law provided: (a) the benefits are to be provided under the
plan for a fixed term; the acceptable period of such a plan shall be such term; or
(b) the employer has filed with
the chairman the required agreements and otherwise complied with section
358-3.4
of this Part; the
acceptable period of such a plan shall be limited to the period provided in
section
358-3.4
(c) of
this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
358-2.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
